Articles.Content:
Somehow, somewhere in kerbal kind, an engineer named Vogt Kerman decided that the kerbal aircraft could not just be built with only a fuselarge in the middle. His ideas, so radical, pushed the current technology of duck tape and old aircraft components. The aircraft he built from these parts went on to be the AS2 - A radical assemetrical aircraft.

This design, which is quite under powered, was just something that I have tried to do for a while. The main parts of the design was a long left hand fuel tank, with the cabin and second fuel tanks on the right. The wing was formed in the middle and the design altered for drag reasons (inculiding the addition of vortex generators on the right fuselage). The engine was then placed and configured from that.

The aircraft is quite annoying to take off with, owing to the lack of thrust from the single engine. But once its in the air, it flies amazingly for a design that looks like it should blow up before the engine is started.

The AS3 was a development of the AS2 design. It has 3 fuel pods, powering two of the after burning jets. This design is just as hard to take off with, but just as rewording to fly.

Welcome to the forums!

Awesome craft , I am a big fan of asymmetric designs.
Awww gawd.... OCD alarms all over the place! Awesome creativity though!

My OCD hates it!

I love it though!
haha. My OCD hates it too, but its a good challange to build thest things.

Bu'... Wha'... Just how???

Seriously I'm impressed, those are some funky looking aircraft and that they fly is impressive in its own right!
I just sat down, decided I wanted to make something that shouldn't fly, fly, and got to work.
You know assimectric desines are the best; now put a huge payload of bombs under the wing and blow **** up
Indeed, assimetric designes are the best, i really like the second one.
Sorry for this, but what is OCD?

Sorry for this, but what is OCD?

Its a Disorder some people assume the have, witch they really don't have.

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Obsessive%E2%80%93compulsive_disorder

Sorry for this, but what is OCD?

Obsessive Compulsive Disorder.

Makes the sufferer want everything to be neat, and makes them focus on it for that reason.
